subject: Cybersecurity
title: The Computer Fraud and Abuse Act: America's First Cyber Law
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Computer Fraud and Abuse Act: America's First Cyber Law.

hook.text: The CFAA was written in 1986 when most Americans had never seen a computer. It still governs cybercrime today.

buildup.text: Inspired by the movie WarGames, Congress passed the CFAA to criminalize unauthorized access to computer systems.

discovery.text: The CFAA makes it illegal to access a computer 'without authorization' or to 'exceed authorized access.' But.

twist.text: Aaron Swartz faced 35 years in prison under the CFAA for downloading academic papers from JSTOR. He was authorized.

climax.text: A 1986 law written because of a movie now determines who goes to prison for computer activities in the internet age.

punchline.text: A Hollywood movie scared Congress into writing cyber law.

quiz.question: What inspired the creation of the Computer Fraud and Abuse Act?
options: The 1983 movie WarGames which depicted hacking into military systems
